Japanese: 開始イベント　終了

English: So this is Lugol!

Japanese:
すげぇ……
こんな大きな街……
はじめてみた。
English:
Incredible...Such a huge city...
It's my first time seeing something like this.

Japanese:
ルゴールは辺境だって聞いてた
けど、クロノの方がよっぽど
辺境だったってことか……。
English: I heard Lugol was in a remote location, but somehow it feels like Chrono Town is way more remote...
The world is so wide.

Japanese:
急ぐよ。
長居したくない。
English:
Let's hurry.
I don't want to stay here any longer than I have to.
This must be the Bullet Workshop.

Japanese:
すごい工房だ。
こんなでかいビル
見たことない……。
English:
It looks so awesome!
I've never seen such a big building before...

Japanese:
なんか、自分が田舎者に
思えてきたぜ。
English: I kinda feel like I'm a country bumpkin here...
Whatever. Just get going.
Welcome to the Bullet Workshop.

Japanese: メリッサ＿ちょっとした驚き

English: Oh, thank you.

Japanese:
私がオーナーのネストラです。
マリオネーションギア協会から
連絡は受けています。
English:
The name's Nestra. I'm the owner.
I got the message from the Marionation Gear Association.

Japanese: メリッサ＿ちょっとした驚き

English: Ah...

Japanese:
……はい。
どうぞ、よろしくお願いします。
English:
...Right.
It's nice to meet you.
I'm Melissa.
Um...from the Galouye Workshop...

Japanese:
聞いてますよ。
まず、弾工房について
説明しましょう。
English:
So I've heard.
To start with, let me tell you a bit about the Bullet Workshop.

Japanese:
この工房では、銃を装備した
マリオネーションギアを
作っています。
English: Here, we create Marionation Gear equipped with guns.

Japanese:
ほとんどが戦闘用のため、
あまり需要はありませんが……
English: They're mostly made for combat, although there's not really much demand for it...

Japanese:
オートマンと戦うには
役に立つはずです。
English: But they should come in handy for fighting the Automen.

Japanese:
本来は、
特別なライセンスのない方には
売らない決まりなんですが、
English: Normally, we have a rule that we can't sell Puppets to people who don't have a special license,

Japanese:
協会から許可が出ていますので、
お譲りできます。
English: but since you've already been approved by the Association, we can let you buy them.
Sweet!

Japanese:
でも、取り扱いには
くれぐれも注意してください。
English: I'm going to have to ask you to treat them with care, though.

Japanese:
わかったよ。
メリッサ、よかったな。
English:
Got it.
Everything worked out fine in the end, right, Melissa?
Y...yeah.

Japanese:
（紳士だし、優しそうだ。
　好戦的だなんて、
　とんでもないよ）
English: (He's a gentleman, and kind to boot. Looks like they're not all militants here.)

Japanese:
そういえば、この街の外で、
銃を持ったマリオネーション
ギアに襲われたんだよ。
English: By the way, we got attacked on the outskirts of the city by a Marionation Gear carrying a gun.
You know anything about that?

Japanese:
それはおそらく、
/c5ガンマン人形/c3だろうね。
English: It was probably the /c5Gunman Puppet/c3.

Japanese:
この工房の作品だよ。
無人の人形だけどね。
English: That's one of our Puppets, albeit an unmanned one.
Huh?

Japanese:
オートマンみたいな
自動人形ってことか？
English: So you're saying it's an autonomous Puppet, like the Automen?

Japanese:
思考回路はオートマンに
遠く及ばないけどね。
English: Its thought processors can't compare to an Automan's.

Japanese:
あの一帯にとどまって、
動くものを撃つように
なっているんだよ。
English: It's programmed to watch over that one area and shoot at anything that moves.

Japanese:
危ないだろ！
何のためにそんなの
作ったんだ？
English:
That's dangerous!
What would you make something like THAT for?
The city's defense.

Japanese:
オートマンが入ってこないよう、
怪しい者を撃つように
なっているわけさ。
English: It's supposed to shoot at anything suspicious, to prevent Automen from getting in.
I'm not sure that's a good idea...
Why not?

Japanese:
いつオートマンが
攻めてくるかもしれないし。
English: We have no idea when an Automan might attack.

Japanese:
街を守るため、
当然の処置だと思うけど。
English: I think it's a natural precaution in order to protect the city.

Japanese: メリッサ＿ちょっとした驚き

English: ...Well, fine.

Japanese:
さて、ガンマン人形は、
もともと搭乗型の人形です。
English: In any case, the Gunman Puppet was originally meant to be piloted.

Japanese:
当然ながら優秀な人形使いが
乗れば、自動制御型など、及び
もつかない能力を発揮しますよ。
English: An excellent Puppeteer could show off some of its non-automatic abilities, naturally.

Japanese:
売り場の方に入れるようにして
おきますので、いつでも
のぞいてみてください。
English: I'll open up the shop, so come and have a look-see anytime.
